akas: Life After Daesh: Exiting Hell (first season title)
Life After Daesh: Returning Home (second season title)
akas from release info: Life After Daesh: Exiting Hell (first season title)
Life After Daesh: Returning Home (second season title)

1.title: Ahmed: I Was an ISIS Policeman
1.plot: After serving as an informant for Al Qaeda, "Ahmed" joins ISIS and becomes a policeman. After seeing how brutally ISIS treats the people of his hometown, "Ahmed" defects and tries to enlist in the Iraqi Army to fight ISIS.

2.title: Oum Saker: The Hostage Mother
2.plot: When her sons are conscripted by ISIS, a Syrian mother reluctantly joins the organization to keep an eye on them. Learning that her sons are going into battle, she plans a risky escape to get her family out of Raqqa.

3.title: Abu Farouq: I Wish I Could Go Back (in Time)
3.plot: After joining ISIS to earn money for his family, Abu Farouq reconsiders his career choice when ISIS blows up his house and almost cuts his throat.

4.title: Muhammad Al-Masri: I Will Fight Again to Fight ISIS
4.plot: Believing that ISIS will liberate his country from the Assad regime, a Syrian businessman joins the organization--only to discover that ISIS intends to destroy his country, not save it.

5.title: Abu Obeida: Lost Youth
5.plot: A Fallujah teenager leaves school to join ISIS and is thrown into combat, where he sees his comrades blown to pieces. Disillusioned and frightened, Abu Obeida crafts a plan to defect from ISIS and bring his family with him.

6.title: Abu Abdellah: A Mountain of Regrets
6.plot: Wanting to avenge the deaths of civilians at the hands of the Assad regime, a Moroccan mechanic joins ISIS in Syria. When he is ordered to shoot innocent civilians, and his best friend is executed, he realizes he made a huge mistake.

7.title: Abu Hafsa: What I Learned at ISIS University
7.plot: After organizing protests against the Iraqi government, an idealistic student joins ISIS. His idealism shatters when he witnesses a horrific ISIS attack on Shiite pilgrims and is drawn into the dark world of ISIS sex slavery.

8.title: Abu Bandar: A Soldier Fights to Regain His Honor
8.plot: An ex-Iraqi soldier joins the Al Qaeda insurgency and becomes one of the first members of ISIS. He is repelled by the brutality and corruption of the Islamic State's leaders and flees to the desert --with ISIS assassins hot on his heels.

9.title: Mohammed from Safi: The Accidental Terrorist
9.plot: Stranded in Libya during the Arab Spring, a Moroccan cook is forced to join ISIS. Another ISIS recruit shares her escape plans, and he finds himself on a rickety boat drifting in the pitch-dark Mediterranean Sea.

10.title: Ahmad: I Was a Teenage ISIS Fighter
10.plot: After a quarrel with his father, a rebellious teenager runs off to Raqaa to join ISIS. But once he sees the enormity of the Islamic State's crimes against civilians and its own jihadists, he has to grow up fast.

11.title: Omar: I Saw Jihad Turn Into Murder
11.plot: A young Lebanese man goes to Syria and joins ISIS to fight the Assad regime. After seeing ISIS murder women and children, he takes drugs to escape the horror of his predicament.

12.title: Mohammed Salafedin: It Began with a Mobile Phone
12.plot: A poor Moroccan farmer is enticed by an online recruiter to go to Syria and join ISIS. But after seeing his ISIS comrades turn on each other and brutalize other Muslims, he realizes the enormity of his mistake.

13.title: Khadija: Runaway Bride of ISIS
13.plot: After being forced to join ISIS as a policewoman, a young Syrian woman finds out that a Tunisian fighter has chosen her to be his wife. Khadija and her family hatch a desperate plan to escape from ISIS and the unwanted wedding.

1.title: LAYLA: A Nurse Heals After ISIS
1.plot: When her husband is captured by ISIS and disappears, a nurse is forced to join the organization and tend to the wounded. "Layla" defects and becomes a refugee in Lebanon --where she finally learns the fate of her husband.

2.title: IHAB: Painting Over the Damage of Daesh
2.plot: A Syrian housepainter joins the resistance against Assad but is forcibly recruited by the Islamic State. "Ihab"is rescued by the FSA and flees to Lebanon where he works as a painter and farm hand to feed his family.

3.title: AYA: My Body Was the Price to Escape Daesh
3.plot: A Syrian student elopes with a Daesh fighter against the wishes of her family. After he is killed, "Aya" is forced to marry three other Daeshis. She escapes to Damascus, where a friend helps her start a sewing business.

4.title: HISHAM: Getting Back on the Right Side of the Law
4.plot: Formerly a policeman, "Hisham" joins the Islamic State to further the political aims of Iraqi Sunnis. After his brother, also an ISIS fighter, is killed, "Hisham" decides to defect back home to Baghdad. He becomes a private security contractor and protects Iraqi government officials from ISIS and other terrorists.

5.title: ABU KHALID: From Wreaking Havoc to Repairing Iraq
5.plot: Abu Khalid operates a successful metalworking shop in Baghdad. But not long ago, he fabricated vehicles for ISIS suicide bombers in Mosul. It's been a long road home, and Abu Khalid is putting painful memories of ISIS behind him, so he can focus on building a future for his family.

6.title: ABOU AHMAD: Keeping the Flame of Learning Alive
6.plot: After serving ISIS as a tax collector and informant, a Syrian teacher smuggles his family to Lebanon and joins them after he defects. Today, "Abou Ahmad" works in a grocery store and tutors the children of Syrian refugees.

7.title: OMRAN: From Making Bombs to Raising Sheep
7.plot: Needing a job to support his family, an engineer becomes an ISIS bomb technician. Horrified by the results of his work, "Omran" returns to his family farm where he raises livestock and helps Iraq recover after years of war.

8.title: KARIMA: Marriage Without Taboo
8.plot: A young Iraqi woman and her new husband join ISIS in Mosul. When he goes into combat near Raqqa, "Karima" is harassed by other Daesh fighters. She escapes to Baghdad without knowing if her husband is dead or alive.

9.title: SALIM: Cooling Off After a Long War
9.plot: After protesting against Assad, an air conditioning technician becomes an ISIS bomb maker. Horrified by what he sees, "Salim"returns to Damascus, gets a pardon, and joins a new cause--to provide a decent life for himself and his family.

10.title: ABU FATIMA: From ISIS Money Man to Car Salesman
10.plot: While serving as a money handler and logistics expert for ISIS, a young Sunni man becomes disillusioned after two of his relatives are murdered. His Kurdish wife helps him escape to Erbil where he starts a car dealership.

11.title: KHALID THE PALESTINIAN: Stitching Together a New Life
11.plot: A tailor leaves a Palestinian refugee camp, joins the Islamic State, and makes fake Syrian Army uniforms to help ISIS agents infiltrate into Syrian cities. Disillusioned by the religious hypocrisy he sees, Khalid takes advantage of Syria's reconciliation program and moves to Damascus, where he starts a thriving tailoring shop.

12.title: Rahman: Daesh intelligence agent
12.plot: After spying for ISIS, a young Sunni man flees to southern Iraq and becomes an apprentice to a Shiite carpenter. "Rahman" falls in love with the carpenter's daughter and decides to build a new life away from sectarian conflict.

-1.title: ABU SUMAIA: A Cook Skewered by ISIS
-1.plot: A cook procures food and drugs for ISIS --until foreign fighters threaten to kill him. Escaping to Baghdad, "Abu Sumaia" opens a restaurant and starts a new life for his family while keeping his past life a secret.

imdb.plot outline: After surviving the horrors of the Islamic State (ISIS), defectors return home to Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon to face another struggle--reconnecting with their families, rebuilding their lives, and finding forgiveness from others -- and themselves.
imdb.title: Life After Daesh
plot: In this groundbreaking TV series, ISIS defectors from Iraq, Syria, Lebanon and Morocco reveal why they joined, what they did, and why they decided to risk their lives to escape from the world's most dangerous terrorist organization.::Mike Tucker

After surviving the horrors of the Islamic State (ISIS), defectors return home to Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon to face another struggle--reconnecting with their families, rebuilding their lives, and finding forgiveness from others -- and themselves.
